paragraphs: Complete Grading Rubric & Reward Point System
This system follows the principle: "Process Earns, Mastery Multiplies."

Students earn steady base points for completing daily work consistently. Bonus multipliers and thematic mastery badges reward demonstrated understanding and long-term retention. This ensures that effort is always valued while excellence is incentivized.
Saxon Math 76 contains 137 lessons organized into 10 linear units with cumulative assessments.
Each of the 137 lessons includes the following graded components:
The course grade is calculated from four categories. Bonuses are applied on top of the base 100%.
Saxon Problem Set: 18% of total grade (accuracy-based)
Each of the 10 unit tests: 2.5% of total grade
Points are earned for each completed component. These points feed directly into the reward system for prizes.
Each flashcard that reaches Leitner Box 7 earns a one-time graduation bonus. This bonus is locked permanently once achieved.
Completing lessons on consecutive days earns streak multipliers applied to daily practice points.
Note: Missing a day resets the streak to Day 1. Weekends and scheduled breaks do not break streaks.
Scoring higher than your previous unit test earns an improvement bonus.
Each lesson is tagged by mathematical theme. Completing all lessons in a theme AND graduating all associated flashcards to Box 7 earns a Mastery Badge with significant bonus points.
To earn a Mastery Badge, a student must:
Complete all lessons tagged with that theme (lecture + problem set + worksheet)
Create all flashcards for those lessons
Graduate ALL flashcards for those lessons to Leitner Box 7
Score 80%+ average on unit tests covering those lessons
Below is the complete mapping of all 137 lessons to their thematic tags. Lessons may have multiple tags when they cover multiple concepts.
The following summarizes the maximum possible points a student can earn in Saxon Math 76.
Assuming ~5 concept cards and ~3 procedure cards per lesson:
Note: Actual totals will vary based on streak length, test improvement patterns, and exact flashcard counts per lesson.
The following letter grade scale applies to the weighted course average (not reward points):
Saxon Problem Sets and Supplementary Worksheets are graded on accuracy (% correct √ó base points)
Perfect scores (100%) earn the accuracy bonus automatically
Lecture attendance is binary: present and engaged = full points, absent = 0
Students must create both Concept and Procedure cards for each lesson
Card creation is verified before earning creation points
Box 7 graduation is tracked per-card and bonuses are awarded once per card lifetime
Cards that fall back from Box 7 do not lose their graduation bonus
A "day" counts when all daily components for one lesson are completed
Completing multiple lessons in one day only counts as one streak day
Pre-scheduled breaks (vacations, holidays) can be marked in advance and won't break streaks
Sick days may be excused with parent discretion (maximum 3 per month)
Unit tests may be retaken once after additional review (higher score kept)
Retake scores are capped at 90% to incentivize first-attempt preparation
Midterm and Final exams cannot be retaken
